item.title: AWS re:Invent was an all-in pitch for AI. Customers might not be ready.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: AWS is releasing a lot of new AI tech, but the cloud infrastructure giant's enterprise customers may not be ready for it yet.

item.title: eSIM adoption is on the rise thanks to travel and device compatibility
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: As a technology, eSIM has been around for a decade now. However, global eSIM adoption was around 3% last year and will only cross 5% this year. Despite these figures, analysts, eSIM-providing startups, and investors are bullish about eSIM's upward trajectory, largely thanks to travel.

item.title: New ‘KnoWay’ robotaxis cause chaos in upcoming Grand Theft Auto Online DLC
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The inclusion of the Waymo look-a-likes appears to be part of a larger storyline that will encourage players to "stop the development of a mass surveillance network."

item.title: New streaming channel launches to give viewers a peek into city council meetings
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Hamlet TV is a way to help keep citizens informed of what's happening inside local governments.

item.title: The New York Times is suing Perplexity for copyright infringement
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: The New York Times filed a copyright lawsuit against Perplexity, joining other publishers using legal action as leverage to force AI companies into licensing deals that compensate content creators.

item.title: Meta signs commercial AI data agreements with publishers to offer real-time news on Meta AI
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Meta is partnering with CNN, Fox News, Fox Sports, Le Monde Group, the People Inc. portfolio of media brands, The Daily Caller, The Washington Examiner, and USA Today.

item.title: Energy storage industry set aggressive goals for 2025 — and already crushed them
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The battery storage industry in the U.S. has grown in leaps and bounds in recent years, surpassing its most aggressive targets to become one of the largest new sources of power on the grid.

item.title: In its first DSA penalty, EU fines X €120M for ‘deceptive’ blue check verification system
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: The EC is taking issue with the fact that X, the social network formerly known as Twitter, has been allowing anyone to buy a "blue checkmark," the platform's long-standing symbol that a user has been verified to be who they are claiming to be.

item.title: Petco confirms security lapse exposed customers’ personal data
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The pet company has published almost no details about what happened, who was affected, and what personal data was exposed.

item.title: Netflix to acquire Warner Bros. in a disruptive deal valued at $82.7B
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: In one of the most groundbreaking deals the streaming world has ever seen, Netflix acquires Warner Bros. for $82.7 billion.

item.title: After Neuralink, Max Hodak is building something even wilder
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: "You could really, in a very fundamental sense, talk about redrawing the border around a brain," Hodak says, "possibly to include four hemispheres, or a device, or a whole group of people."

item.title: Walmart-backed PhonePe winds down its Pincode app in yet another e-commerce step back
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: PhonePe has shut down its Pincode app over two years after its debut. The company said it will now focus on working with offline retailers by expanding its B2B offerings.

item.title: Chicago Tribune sues Perplexity
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The newspaper is alleging copyright infringement and calling out Perplexity's retrieval augmented generation (RAG) as a culprit.

item.title: All the biggest news from AWS’ big tech show re:Invent 2025
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec, Julie Bort, Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Amazon Web Services' giant tech conference re:Invent 2025 is happening this week with news ranging from chips to AI services.

item.title: Feds ask Waymo about robotaxis repeatedly passing school buses in Austin
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The agency already opened an investigation in October over Waymo's performance around school buses. Waymo said it issued a software update to its fleet to improve performance.

item.title: Micro1, a Scale AI competitor, touts crossing $100M ARR
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: Micro1 started the year with roughly $7 million ARR. Now, it claims to have surpassed $100 million in ARR, double what it reported in September.

item.title: Apple’s executive shake-up continues with departures of general counsel and policy head
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Apple loses two more top senior executives with exits of longtime general counsel Kate Adams and environmental VP Lisa Jackson. Meta’s Jennifer Newstead is set to join as new general counsel in 2026.

item.title: Anthropic CEO weighs in on AI bubble talk and risk-taking among competitors
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Anthropic's CEO shared his thoughts on the economics of AI and the risk-taking of competitors, saying some were "YOLO-ing" with regard to spending.

item.title: Musk says new Tesla software allows texting and driving, which is illegal in most states
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Texting while driving is banned in nearly every state, even with the use of advanced driver-assistance systems like Tesla's Full Self-Driving (Supervised) software.

item.title: From the NFL to Startup Battlefield: How Alltroo built a brand that wins
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: On season one of Build Mode: Product, Meet Market, we explore what it really takes to get your product into the hands of customers.
